Why Is Weight Management Important?

Maintaining a healthy weight is crucial because being overweight or underweight can lead to serious health problems:

  • Obesity Risks: Diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure, joint pain, and sleep apnea.
  • Underweight Risks: Weak immunity, nutrient deficiencies, osteoporosis, and fatigue.
  • Metabolic Disorders: PCOS, thyroid imbalances, and hormonal issues.

Common Symptoms of Weight-Related Problems

Watch out for these signs that you may need weight management:

  • For Overweight/Obesity: Constant fatigue, shortness of breath, frequent hunger, joint pain.
  • For Underweight: Low energy, frequent illnesses, poor muscle strength, irregular periods.
  • Metabolic Warning Signs: High sugar levels, cholesterol issues, stubborn belly fat.
